message.content: This question asks about the effect of absorbing sun rays on the temperature of an object. When an object absorbs sun rays, it gains energy. This increase in energy causes the temperature of the object to rise. The option (A) correctly states that absorbing sun rays raises the Fahrenheit of an object. Option (B) is incorrect because absorbing sun rays does not lower the Celsius of an object. Option (C) is also incorrect because absorbing sun rays does not cause the object to cool. Option (D) is not a scientifically accurate way to describe the temperature change that occurs when an object absorbs sun rays.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the effects of sun rays on the temperature of an object. When an object absorbs sun rays, the energy from the sun is converted into heat. This increase in heat causes the temperature of the object to rise, which is measured in Fahrenheit. Option (B) is incorrect because absorbing sun rays does not lower the temperature of the object in Celsius. Option (C) is incorrect because absorbing sun rays causes the object to heat up, not cool down. Option (D) is incorrect because descending temperature implies a decrease in temperature, whereas absorbing sun rays actually increases the temperature of the object.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of sun rays on objects. When an object absorbs sun rays, it gains energy and its temperature increases. Option (B) is incorrect because absorbing sun rays does not lower the Celsius temperature of an object. Option (C) is incorrect because absorbing sun rays actually causes the object to warm up, not cool down. Option (D) is a synonym for cooling, so it is also incorrect.

Option (C) is also incorrect because absorbing sun rays would not cause the object to cool. Option (D) is incorrect because "descend" is not a term commonly used to describe a change in temperature.

Option (D) is incorrect because "descend" means to go down, but absorbing sun rays causes the temperature to go up, not down.
